thread.title: Manchester United sanction Wayne Rooney’s move to China – for next Tuesday [Mirror]
thread.title_full: Manchester United sanction Wayne Rooney’s move to China – for next Tuesday [Mirror]

author: Paul Morrissey
title: Manchester United sanction Wayne Rooney’s move to China – for next Tuesday [Mirror]
text:
Manchester United sanction Wayne Rooney’s move to China – for next Tuesday [Mirror] By Paul Morrissey   Rooney to China? 
Talk of Wayne Rooney moving to China first surfaced towards the end of 2016. 
In the last year, the Chinese league has stepped up its bid to become a major global player by attracting several big stars from Europe, and the the Chinese Super League chiefs now want to lure Wayne Rooney away from Manchester United. 
Rooney has three years to run on his current deal, which judging by the irreversible decline that his career is now in, will probably be his last at Old Trafford. 
But with the Chinese transfer window still open until the end of this month, talk of Rooney making the move Far East has resurfaced of late, and now things are getting serious. Deal agreed, move could happen next week 
Indeed, according to the backpage of tomorrow’s Mirror, Manchester United have sanctioned Rooney’s move to China, and that everything is being set up for the move to happen by next Tuesday – the Chinese transfer window deadline. 
So is this really how Rooney’s illustrious Manchester United career is going to end? Leaving through the back door in the middle of the season? Winner Betting Odds
